programmes.show_description: Australia's busiest ambulance service are called to a work site explosion, a motor vehicle accident, and a young boy getting himself trapped in his toy.
Louis meets patients at two of London's largest eating disorder facilities, following them through a daily routine of scheduled eating, weigh-ins and group therapy.

programmes.show_name: Louis Theroux: The Most Hated Family in America
programmes.show_description: Wry observer of oddballs Louis Theroux turns his attention to the Phelps clan who picket America, promoting an intolerance of gay life.
Three contestants hope to answer their way to a fortune, guided by Bill Bailey, Scarlett Moffatt, William Hanson, Big Zuu, John Bercow, Denise Lewis and Anna Richardson.
Shopping from Home.
Sitting Targets: Family sitcom. Susan decides that Ben should spend more time with Michael in case he turns into another Nick. Janey leaves the grandparents to babysit Kenzo.
Loco Parentis: Putting the 'dysfunctional' into 'family' is the domestic comedy with the madcap Harpers. Ben and Susan have to go back to school for parenting classes.
Canary Cage: The Harpers get a free holiday to Lanzarote, and even though Ben loses his luggage, he is happy enough to use his brand new digital camera as much as possible.
May the Best Man Win: Are all families this barmy? It's the ratings-topping domestic sitcom with the Harpers. Abi's father asks Ben to be his best man - a bad move!
It's a Window Filled Life: Fun with the Harpers. Roger's got a disease, Nick gets to work with an 18ft python and Michael plays with a rocket launcher. Just an average day, then!
The Mummy Returns: The hugely popular family sitcom. Janey comes back home, Susan lies to the police, Michael's become born again and Abi confuses nature with naturism.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Betsy & Angel: Cockapoo Betsy was hit by a van five months ago and has developed gangrene, while bite-size bijou Dogue de Bordeaux puppy Angel has a genetic deformity.
Saving Noel's Dog: When Noel's beloved Border Terrier Keira is hit by a van, he must face the possibility that she may not be fixable.
Inca, Nala & Charles: Anxious two-year-old Cavapoo Nala arrives for a hip replacement, and Great Dane Charles was diagnosed a spinal condition known as Wobbler Syndrome.
Angus & Rocky: Goldendoodle Angus fell 20 metres and sustained nerve damage, while irrepressible Springer Spaniel Rocky's failed elbow operation has left him struggling to walk.
Trigger, Fury & Raven: Police dog Trigger has crushed sciatic nerves, feisty kitten Fury has a tibia injury, and Shepadoodle Raven has double hip dysplasia.
On shift with West Midlands Ambulance Service who treat a young lad with a fever, a golf-loving pensioner with a heart problem and a woman convinced she has lung cancer.
An asthmatic deteriorates rapidly in the ambulance, and the crews are called to a 30-year-old car that's been driven into a wall by a 90-year-old driver.
Teenager Nathan has two twisted teeth extracted, Bob has keyhole surgery for a groin hernia, and 96-year-old Peggy entertains the team while having a growth removed from her toe.
Jonathan has a camera put inside his lungs to find out if he has cancer. James needs a knee operation so he can play with his children again, and a growth is removed from Jan's ear.
You Don't Do This Job for the Money: Newly-qualified Tacha is still getting to grips with the pace of a busy ward. Summah, who is registered blind, uses all her experience in theatre.
Louis spends two weeks in California's notorious San Quentin State Prison, meeting some long-term inmates and getting to grips with their intriguing inner culture.

programmes.show_name: Louis Theroux: Altered States: Take My Baby
programmes.show_description: Louis Theroux explores open adoption in California, where women hand over their babies at birth to adoptive families paying tens of thousands of dollars for the privilege.

...Most Hated Family in Crisis. Following up on his 2007 documentary, The Most Hated Family in America, Louis Theroux returns to Topeka, Kansas, for a week-long visit with the Westboro Baptist Church.
Gemma Collins, Dara O Briain, Fred Sirieix, Rochelle Humes, Lorraine Kelly, Jordan Banjo and Liam Charles join in the fun this time around.
Shopping from Home.
The cooks must create a dish with an unexpected element of surprise. Will it be a taste surprise, a hidden surprise, or a trick of the eye?
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Birmingham: Life-changing property transformations. The team get to work on a cramped house in Birmingham for a couple whose twin children have global development delay.
Hopesay: Life-changing property makeovers. Volunteers in Shropshire rally around firefighter Joe and his young daughter Lucy after the sudden death of wife and mother Jess.
Cheltenham: Home renovation series. The team are in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, to help 17-year-old disabled athlete Scott Jones achieve his dream of going to Tokyo 2020.

Property renovation series hosted by Drew and Jonathan Scott. Craig and Laurel quickly sold their previous property and are now looking for their ultimate dream home.
Popular property renovation series hosted by Drew and Jonathan Scott. Tired of living in a cramped rental apartment, Gina is ready for a home where she can entertain in style.
Birmingham: Life-changing property transformations. The team get to work on a cramped house in Birmingham for a couple whose twin children have global development delay.
Coco, Sapphire and the Cheese Chis: Pete helps rescue six Chihuahuas from the home of a hoarder and witnesses the emotional handover of a pregnant pug and her sister.
Simba, Cato & Tynee: Persian cat Simba was hit by a car, and the complex treatment involves a skin graft and putting his crushed bones back together. Rescue dog Cato has a cancerous tumour.
Albie, Flora & Parker: A puppy has a broken back from being knocked over by a car, and Noel must use old-fashioned detective work to diagnose a Scottish terrier's mysterious ailment.
More maternal moments from Liverpool Women's Hospital. Gareth and Jenny focus on their new adventure into parenthood. Tina and Alan want to experience a natural birth.
